#Text=Anonymous distributed flyers and informed passers-by about Scientology .
#Text=In a speech , they called for a dialogue with Scientology members , and said they were concerned for the parishioners ' well-being :
#Text=“ To the Scientologists who fear us : You have nothing to fear from our peaceful protests .
#Text=We are here because we care about you .
#Text=We demonstrate only against the abuses of the Church management and we stand by your individual freedom of religion . ”
#Text=Operation : Party Hard - expect us , with cake
#Text=was closed off with a birthday cake for the protesters .
#Text=Belgian media were in attendance with a film crew from RTBF interviewing several of the protesters and capturing their banners on tape .

#Text=The slogans were mostly in English , ranging from " Religion is free , Scientology is n't " to " One billion years of servitude = super powers " — the latter a reference to the contracts that Scientologists sign when they become involved with the church 's Sea Org .

column1: #Text=The police presence was low-key with only one senior officer and a member of the Belgian intelligence services who took photographs .
#Text=Brussels Gallery
#Text=The protesters arrive at the Stock Exchange and start folding flyers .
#Text=Anonymous
#Text=members , wearing the black uniform with red tie , discuss Scientology with passers-by .
#Text=A volunteer speaks to a group of youngsters .
#Text=Pedestrians were given flyers about Scientology and its practices .
#Text=Protester with sign saying : Tom Cruise ca n't fly , you guys
#Text=A protester shows his banner to the press .
#Text=The group brings the global speech .
#Text=Anonymous sings a birthday song for L. Ron Hubbard , Scientology 's founder ...
#Text=... followed by birthday cake for the protesters .
#Text=We get offered cake , decorated with a card that criticises Scientology .
#Text=Protesters eating cake .
#Text=By the end of the demonstration , the police asks Anonymous to leave .
#Text=At Scientology 's headquarters , an alleged ' open door day ' celebrates the declaration of human rights .
#Text=A Scientologist waiting to hand out flyers .
#Text=Scientology 's headquarter is located in Law Street no . 91 , in the political heart of Brussels .
#Text=An exposition inside the Scientology building proudly displays the IRS ruling over Scientology 's tax-exempt status under the header " U. S government recognition " .

column1: #Text=The second panel is devoted to international recognition .
#Text=London
#Text=, England
#Text=Correspondents : Adambro , Skenmy , JamesHarrison
#Text=Once more , protests took place outside of both the Queen Victoria Scientology Headquarters and the Tottenham Court Road Dianetics centre .

#Text=The additional time available for protesters in the aftermath of a rushed February 10th protest allowed the many of Anonymous to expand their protest to include even more outreach towards members of the public , with Anonymous members handing out free cake , sweets and other confectionery along with leaflets and stickers to passers-by .
#Text=Signage was loud and varied , proclaiming a variety of messages to the public and Scientologists .
#Text=Many of the signs declared amusing yet pointed comments , with others making more serious jabs at the Church of Scientology .
